newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Bank PDFCI gets rights issue approval.
newsitem.headline: Bank PDFCI gets rights issue approval.

text.p: PT Bank Private Development Finance Company of Indonesia (PDFCI) has received shareholders' approval for a one-for-one rights issue, the Jakarta Post newspaper reported on Thursday.
Bank PDFCI president Eddie Tong was quoted as saying the bank would issue 93.75 million shares, and the proceeds would be used to increase its paid-up capital to 187.5 billion rupiah.
He said the shares would be sold to existing shareholders at 1,600 rupiah each. He said the bank expected its syndication loans to total some $2 billion this year.
Tong said the bank obtained shareholders' approval at a meeting in Jakarta on Wednesday.
In an advertisement in the Binis Indonesia newspaper, Bank PDFCI said proceeds from the rights issue would also be used to enhance its financial structure and increase lending.
